name.str: USB drive with a bootstrap compiler

description: This USB drive contains a very basic compiler written directly in binary machine code by some mad genius. It's not much good for anything besides compiling a better compiler on a machine that has no development tools, but you could install it on a computer.

name.str: USB drive with a homebrew compiler

description: This USB drive contains a competently written compiler for a homebrew programming language, along with documentation for the language itself and a few useful libraries. It doesn't do any fancy optimization and lacks cross-platform compatibility, but you can write real code with it - albeit with a very simplistic language.

This USB drive contains a hex editor, decompiler and some associated analytic software. If you were in an apocalyptic scenario and had with no access to code documentation, you might use it to gain some insight into the operation and APIs of some compiled code. It would be a huge mind-numbing pain, but it would be possible.

name.str: USB drive with professional compiler software
name.str_pl: USB drives with professional compiler software

description: This USB drive includes a suite of professional software development tools, including an IDE, compiler, build system, and an archive of useful software libraries with offline documentation.  You could install it in a computer and write some code.

name.str: USB drive with makeshift AI SDK
name.str_pl: USB drive with makeshift AI SDK

description: This USB drive contains a hacky AI SDK reverse-engineered from firmware dumps of AI cores.  It's jank AF, but you could probably program some simple AI modules using it if you're brave enough.

name.str: USB drive with basic AI core software
name.str_pl: USB drives with basic AI core software

description: This USB drive contains the source code for a simple AI core.  It's not very useful on its own, but with the right tools you could compile it, construct an AI core, and install it.

This device replaces conventional battery connections with a connector port that can plug into a UPS.  Any device modified with this can be used without a battery as long as you have a charged UPS with you.
A battery compartment mod that allows using vehicle batteries and small storage batteries in regular tools.
A battery compartment mod that allows the use of light batteries in tools that otherwise could not.
A battery compartment mod that allows the use of medium batteries in tools that otherwise could not.
A battery compartment mod that allows the use of heavy batteries in tools that otherwise could not.
